channel.title: PS3 Maintenance
channel.description: Well for most of you ps3 users you know it's down for maintenance sadly. I'm posting this because I'm really curious about something, my friend lives less then an hour away from me and is able to sign in through the maintenance, but I can't? Also it was extended by like 9 hours so I'm pissed.

item.title: PS3 Maintenance
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Kodiak:

I payed for my ps3 with full intentions of online play, I’m not trying to take them to court and it looks like thats what your making it out to be, I’m just ranting here. It was only meant to be a discussion.

I’m not making the situation out to be anything. I replied to RS PS, because he said they have no excuse, when in reality, they can give you any excuse they want without informing you of anything. I never once said you had the intentions of taking them to court, or even that it seemed like you wanted to take some type of legal action against them. Please, stop trying to be superior by pushing your wits to their limit. I’m growing tired of you always trying to prove a point that seems to have magically appeared out of oblivion.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 Maintenance
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Since my brother is the “owner” of the ps3 now (In his room) I haven’t been on in a long af time, so I wouldn’t know

But I did hear from some people today/yesterday about downtime

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 Maintenance
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

Building the PS3 itself wouldn’t even cost up to 100 dollars. I’m pretty damn sure that the other half of the money is for customer service, the software, etc.

item.title: PS3 Maintenance
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“RS PS, post:3, topic:478689”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=596909.msg4203236#msg4203236 date=1358543520]
They don’t charge you to use their network to play with others, so it is completely fine.
[/quote]

That’s no excuse.[/quote]
Logically, it is an excuse. They don’t just come out of the blue and state that, but what professional company would? The point is that you use their online service for free and they do not guarantee any up-time.

Read full topic
